event.name: BSN_TEMPERATURE_EXCEEDED
event.message: Temperature of a chassis component exceeded threshold
event.description:
This notification is generated when the temperature of a chassis component has exceeded some threshold. The instance of s5ChasComType included in the notification identifies the component.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) s5ChasComType

event.name: BSN_LOGIN_FAILURE
event.description:
This notification is generated when an attempt to login to the system fails as a result of an incorrect password.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) bsnLoginFailureType 3) bsnLoginFailureAddressType 4) bsnLoginFailureAddress 5) bsnLoginFailureUsername

event.name: BSN_STACK_CONFIGURATION_ERROR
event.message: Stack configuration error (expected size %2, actual size %3)
event.description:
This notification is generated when the expected size of a stack is not equal to the actual size of the stack.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Expected stack size 3) Actual stack size

event.name: BSN_TRIAL_LICENSE_EXPIRATION
event.description:
This notification is generated to indicate that a trial license is going to expire soon, or has already expired.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) The number of days until a feature trial license will expire 3) The number of the license that will expire or that has expired

event.name: BSN_LAC_TRUNK_UNAVAILABLE
event.description: This notification is generated when an attempt is made to form an 802.3ad LAG trunk, but there are no available resources to create a new trunk. The condition usually occurs because a system has some hardware or software limit on the number of trunks that can be created.

event.name: BSN_TRUNK_PORT_ENABLED
event.description:
This notification is generated when an MLT port is enabled.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Interface index

event.name: BSN_STACK_MANAGER_RECONFIGURATION
event.description: This notification is generated by a stackable system when the stack manager detects a problem with a link between stack members.

event.name: BSN_CONFIG_SAVED
event.description: This notification is generated whenever the device saves its configuration to non-volatile storage.

event.name: BSN_MLT_HEALTH_FAILURE
event.description: This notification is generated when a receiving switch does not receive an expected number of autotopology frames on an MLT in a given time interval from the sending switch(es) on the other end of the MLT. Once notification has been sent, further notifications may be sent, but it is suggested these be at least 5 minutes apart. The ifAdminStatus object reflects the state of the port. The port may be partitioned by the switch or still be active depending on the detection algorithm's control parameters.

event.name: BSN_TRUNK_PORT_DISABLED
event.message: Trunk port %2 disabled to prevent broadcast storm
event.description:
This notification is generated when an MLT port is disabled as a result of an MLT trunk being disabled.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Interface index

event.name: BSN_VLACPDU_LOSS
event.message: Port %2 was disabled due to VLACP PDU loss
event.description:
Generated when a port is disabled due to the loss of a VLACP PDU.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Interface index

event.name: BSN_PORT_SPEED_SUPLEX_MISMATCH
event.message: Speed or duplex mismatch on port %2
event.description:
This notification is generated when a speed or duplex mismatch is detected. Once notification has been sent, further notifications may be sent, but it is suggested these be at least 5 minutes apart.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Interface index

event.name: BSN_PORT_DISABLED_BSTORM
event.message: Port %2 was disabled to prevent broadcast storm
event.description:
This notification is generated when a LAG port that was port of a trunk is disabled as a result of the LAC setting on the port being turned off.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Interface index

event.name: BSN_VLACPDU_RECEIPT
event.message: Port %2 was enabled due to receipt of a VLACP PDU
event.description:
Generated when a port is enabled due to receipt of a VLACP PDU.
Parameters: 1) SNMP trap OID 2) Interface index
